Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC G711 codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC G711 speech codec is fully compliant with ITU-T G.711 specification for Pulse Code Modulation of Voice Frequencies with Appendixes I and II promoted by International Telecommunication Union ( www.itu.org ) and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions. The USC G711 codec supports 16bit narrowband 8000 Hz PCM signal compression and decompression with 10ms frame length at 64 kbps producing 640 bits per frame (bpf).

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC G711 comprises of two codecs with following parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_G711A

  • Compression algorithm: A-law PCM

  • Linkage: USC_G711A_Fxns

  • Sampling rate: 16bit linear 8000 Hz

  • Frame: 10ms

  • Bitrates: 64000 bps (640 bpf - voice, 16 bpf - SID),

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD supported, compatible with G729B

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame types (value): Untransmitted (0), SID (1),Voice (3), Bad 1 (-1)

  • Standards: ITU-T G711, G711I, G711II. 

 

  • Codec name: IPP_G711U

  • Compression algorithm: Mu-law PCM

  • Linkage: USC_G711U_Fxns

  • Sampling rate: 8000 Hz

  • Frame: 10ms

  • Bitrates: 64000 bps (640 bpf - voice, 16 bpf - SID),

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD supported, compatible with G729B

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame types (value): Untransmitted (0), SID (1),Voice (3), Bad 1 (-1)

  • Standards: ITU-T G711, G711I, G711II.
